Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: accura_sg
Reviews.Content: Hotel located at the Lido island and is about 30 mins boat ride from the main train station in Venice. The hotel is about 300m away from the ferry jetty and is located beside a supermart and there are a few nice restaurant a short walk from the hotel. small room with clean bathroom. no free wifi. There's an elevator in this hotel and the staff are helpful. Breakfast buffet was good.

Reviews.Title: “Lovley Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gillian p
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 days, the hotel is not a 4 star, but maybe a 3, but its a lovley hotel, the staff were very very helpful, nothing was too much trouble, the rooms were clean, the breakfast perfectly adequate, its a few minutes walk from the vaporetta, and ferries, i would fully reccomend it to anyone, I too reccomend buying the 72hr pass with the airport transfer, online from venice connected, also get the secret itinary tour round the doges palace, this was very interesting, and gets you into places the ordinary tours dont,

Reviews.Title: “Good Location Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Vincent131006
Reviews.Content: This is the fourth time in Venice and the second time at this Hotel. Good value and a great jump off point for the main island without the high expense of Venice Hotels. Lido is a good place to relax in the evening and the restaurant prices are far better value than Venice itself. Good staff, very helpful and the room was clean warm and well serviced. We found a useful tick to save money from Marco Polo, use a number 5 (land) bus then buy the day or three day pass. Saved about 40 euro and was in fact quicker than the Water Bus from Marco Polo. Would recommend for this looking for value and a good base to explore.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and clean”
Reviews.Author: Leah H
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend found this online and after staying at the hotel for two nights we greatly enjoyed it. We came to venice by train from Rome and took a water taxi to Lido island. It was very easy to do this, and the hotel is very centrally located on the island. The hotel was very nice and clean. We had a very large bathroom too. Breakfast was one that was buffet, but us being a younger couple we didn't mind it at all. Getting to the mainland was a little expensive, I think about 13 euro each. However it was nice to go back and relax on a quieter island at night. I would greatly recommend this. For the price its a great, friendly and very clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this scam hotel at all costs”
Reviews.Author: Simon R
Reviews.Content: We'd booked this hotel for three nights just before Easter. When we arrived at the reception, a smooth-talking man casually informed us that our room was no longer available because rain had caused some pipes to leak. He assured us everything would be fine because he'd secured us a room at their 'sister' hotel down the road that was also 4*. However, it quickly became clear that it was 4* in name only. We were put in the smallest room we've ever seen. Even worse, it was on the ground floor barely 3 metres from the reception desk. We'd thought the guy was joking when he said he'd show us to our room and then walked four paces to his left, but no! We asked if we could move room but lo and behold, the hotel was apparently fully-booked for the full three nights we were due to stay. So we had no choice but to endure three restless nights due to the noise as people passed in and out of reception late into the night and first thing in the morning. Not even close to a 4* experience. Worst of all was the manner in which the receptionist treated us - he was blunt, dismissive, and couldn't care one hoot that we were unhappy at being moved to another hotel and then being put in such a pathetically small room. We got the distinct impression that because we'd got a good price on hotels.com, we shouldn't expect anything more from them. There is another review on this site and it tells an almost identical story about 'leaking pipes' and being moved to a low-grade sister hotel. The reviewer suggested this was a scam intended to help fill undesirable rooms at this worse hotel down the road. On this experience, I'd have to agree. We still enjoyed our stay in Venice but it was no thanks to the hotel. And even now, the experience leaves a bitter taste in the mouth. We'd really recommend that to avoid the possibility of being scammed yourself, you avoid this hotel at all costs. This clearly isn't a one-off and it's not worth risking the enjoyment of your holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Fab deal for the money”
Reviews.Author: sandyManchester
Reviews.Content: Just returned from staying here on a special deal with Broadway travel, loved staying on the lido and spending time on the waterbuses up and down the grand canal all day, hotel was nice, clean reasonable sized room , bit of mould on bathroom ceiling but otherwise great,No kettle in the room tho so take your own if u want one, fair choice of food for breakfast , pleasant staff, quiet area a few places to eat/bars/coffee shops, right opposite a supermarket too . Flew with ryan Air, didn't prebook transfers so was a bit worried, but no need, the Ryanair bus was waiting outside the airport, took us to the main bus station at piazza de Roma,where u can buy a various types of ticket for all the waterbuses, we chose a 72 hr one for 33 Euroes each which saved us a fortune and meant we could hop on and off the very frequent waterbuses at our leisure, the bus from the airport takes about an hour and costs 13 euros return , and the waterbus to the Lido takes about another hour along the beautiful grande canal.wetaher was very mild for fen too, didnt need a coat a lot of the time, watch out for cheap "touriste menus" as you will get charged extortionate rates for drinks and service charges..Would definately recommend this for a budget stay , on our return to the bus station we had no trouble at all finding the Ryanair avto Airport bus ready to transport us back to treviso Airport for our return flight

Reviews.Title: “Basic Accom - great location”
Reviews.Author: gypsyberry
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a package deal. The location was perfect - close to everything on Lido island and a Supermarket directly next door (despite us walking round in circles trying to find one) A 10 min or so walk to the other side of the island where the beach is, but we preferred being on the waterfront side. The Vapperettos were easy to use and navigate and the cost of the tickets wasn't much. We enjoyed not being in the thick of the tourist traps of the main island. The room in the hotel was very small, but clean. The decor was a bit dated but we were only there a few days and out and about all day anyway- so were not fussed by this. A redeeming factor was that there was a fridge which we found useful for storing our gorgeous deli meats and cheeses. The breakfast was also a good spread of Hot food as well as Continental style toast /cereals and fruits. Over all - for what we paid and the location it was a good place to stay. The only downside was the size of the room. The service at the hotel was great, they helped us with overweight luggage issues (curse you RyanAir :) ) and were just generally very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great Position”
Reviews.Author: CovDemon
Reviews.Content: Despite the confusing Vaporretto system it was in fact very simple to find being on most of the lines, 5.1, 1, 6 being the main ones straight from the Bus terminal at Piazza Roma or the train station at Ferrovia. Nice hotel right by the seafront only 5 mins from the beach and 2 mins fronm the ferry terminal and lots of bars and places to eat. The hotel itself I would not say was 5*, the rooms were clean but very small and alittle dated as was the bathroom. The staff were very friendly but overworked especially the guy who seemed to do breakfast single handed. The breakfast itself was good but utter chaos as as it was badly set out and even when not busy the one guy struggled to serve, clear tables, bring out fresh food and crockery etc. Having said all this you are in italy and it is Venice so space is at a premium. Cost wise I think it was a bargain and with the close proximity to the ferry, very nice restaurant opposite and a supermarket next door you would struggle to find a better location. We did meet people who stayed in central Venice who had difficulty finding their hotel down all the narrow streets plus dragging cases was difficult, with ferrys running every 10 mins 24 hours a day the Lido is definately a winner.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent but NOT four-star”
Reviews.Author: 4hersheybear
Reviews.Content: The Good: Location - Lido worked out perfectly. Plenty of vaporettos (buy the unlimited travel pass), quick travel to San Marco and other sites. Quiet island in the winter but plenty of places to eat/ shopping. Breakfast - the best of the 3 hotels we stayed at in Italy. Abhorrent coffee but ok if mixed with hot chocolate. Scrambled eggs a plus! Room - sparkling clean room and bathroom. Springiest beds of 3 hotels we stayed in. Service - helpful and reliable front desk staff. The Bad: cluttered lobby, dingy hallways, needs updating. The Ugly: MOLD - yikes! Don't look up in the bathroom - the ceiling was spattered with black mold. More gross than anything else, but could be a particular problem for the severely allergic.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel to explore from”
Reviews.Author: bellamanning
Reviews.Content: Good basic hotel to explore from We also went on the Broadway Travel/Travelzoo deal, which was excellent value for money. However the Boulevard Hotel is definitely not what we would call 4 star. Our room was tiny, there was only just enough space to squeeze past the double bed. The bathroom was very nice, with a bidet and a proper bath, which was most welcome after a day of walking in freezing cold weather. It was also nice and warm in the room. The room and bathroom were kept very clean and the towels and sheets were changed daily, which was very good. Toiletries are replaced every day. The breakfast was quite adequate and the overworked waiters tried their best to keep up with the constant stream of guests, but tables were left uncleared; the hot dishes were not replenished that swiftly and the fruit bowl was not topped up but disappeared when empty. There was no brown or wholemeal bread, or salad bits. I nearly caused a riot on our second morning by bringing in my own tomatoes which I had purchased from the BILLA supermarket next door (very handy). People were constantly coming up to me and asking where I got the tomatoes from! There are good value restaurants with excellent pizzas as well and proper meals if you turn left out of the hotel and head away from the boat terminal. There is also a good restaurant opposite. The reception staff were indifferent and did not go out of their way to answer questions or volunteer information. They were very matter-of-fact. We were all made to wait until 2.00pm before being allowed to check-in and were then moaned at for wanting our rooms at 2.00pm on the dot. Maybe that is why they put us in such a tiny room! The whole place is a bit musty and the walls were very marked and the furniture well used and dirty. It could all do with a fresh coat of paint at the very least. The electric cables in our room were rather dodgy and the mirror inside the wardrobe had been broken at the top and sticky-taped back together! The small flat-screen TV did have BBC World News and CNN in English, but it certainly was not a 4 star room. Overall, and depending on how good a deal you can get it was fine, but don't expect luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel but Beware”
Reviews.Author: Chris_Halford
Reviews.Content: Pros Clean Tidy Hotel, bit dated but comfortable and friendly Good location - one minutes walk from water bus Couple of decent priced restaurants close by Negatives It is on Lido so that you have to get water bus to main island (takes 15 minutes) however price you should pay reflects this and the water bus is part of the fun of Venice. Breakfast is OK however seem short staffed so room does not cleared and food does not get refreshed as fast as it should. Don't leave it to last minute as there will be none left. BIG WARNING - do not use Credit Card to make overseas calls as advertised in rooms. I tried , could not make a call and they tried (the phone company) to charge me Â£39 - luckily my credit card company blocked it. Use the reception if you want long distance. Summary: Is it value for money - yes Would I stay there again - yes Is it suitable for everyone -yes only if you don't mind the water bus.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel on Lido”
Reviews.Author: mrblondny
Reviews.Content: Pros: convenient in summer, good staff, good breakfast, rooms are decently sized Cons: needs a serious cleaning, much of Lido is closed in the winter One block from the vaporetto station, it takes 15 minutes to get to St Marks on the #1 boat which runs quite frequently up the grand canal. The staff was very helpful with excursion tickets and restaurant reservations. Breakfast was good and varied, with a mix of Continental and American favorites. That said there is no restaurant in the hotel for other meals. The hotel does have a few years' worth of marks on the walls and really needs a good cleaning and paint. If you don't mind being out of central Venice and the weather is warm, it's a solid choice for budget travelers.

Reviews.Title: “December in Venice”
Reviews.Author: shekel
Reviews.Content: Booked a brilliant deal with Broadway travel through Travelzoo. So cheap we didnt expect much from the hotel. Arrived to be told they had no booking for us (nor for the other 2 parties who arrived at the same time). Got sorted quite quickly. I had read reviews on the hotel and asked for a quiet room that wasnt too small. Got a noisey room that was like a match box but the bathroom was nice. The manager told us he gets 6 paparazzi in it during the film festival week though we could not work out how! It didnt matter because the location to the water boats was good and that's all we needed to get over to the main Island (20 mins trip).The room had a mini fridge and tv so it was ok. No kettle though so you may wish to take your own. Beds and pillows quite hard but that seems to be the way in Italy? Supermarket next door for milk, water, wine etc Venice is beautiful and we loved every minute. Food in restaurants is dreadful and expensive so dont go expecting fine dining. Our first night out we fancied real Italian pasta...it came microwaved from frozen and cost a small fortune! This is not unusual. Staff are rather matter of a fact but they do the job. I believe the hotel gets very busy in Summer and at film festival time so I dont think we would visit then. Breakfast was fine....plenty and nice and not many other guests. Lido island itself has nothing special in the winter so all time will be spent on the other islands - there are no canals nor Venetian beauty to it. It is a seaside resort in the summer for Italians so will get busy. Eating places are open but not very good. Likewise the shops. Plenty to do in Venice - highlights are island hopping (water boats are so easy to use and very frequent) and wandering around Venice itself. Murano, Burano and Torcello can all easily be done in one day and are lovely. Avoid buying "cheap" Murano glass ware...no such thing, they are Chinese imports! (Buy a travel card for 72 hours usually lasts for 4 day stay) for 33E as soon as you start using them. On sale everywhere. This will get you anywhere you want. If you are into books and history....try a visit to the Armenian monestry which is on its own beautiful island - catch the Boat number 20 mid afternoon and a guide will meet you and take you around for about 6E. Tour lasts about 90 mins then they see you back again. Some fascinating history, objects and manuscripts. Very easy to do and you dont have to book in advance. There were only 6 on our trip so it was lovely and personal. Guide speaks all languages. Rialto market early every morning is great for fresh fruit and produce and the eating places are a bit cheaper round there. Toilets are expensive everywhere (even on remote islands) - nearly Â£1.50 a go unless you are in a cafe. No free ones that we could find! Easy to get to Lido from Trevisso....bus outside airport then water bus. Everyone else seemed to be doing the same thing so follow the crowd. This bus is extra to the 33E and is about 9E each way....save a bit by buying a return. Check times back...this bus is not as frequent as water buses. The bus service is run to meet the Ryan air flights to/from Trevisso so all the staff know what is going on. The Doge's palace is worth the entry fee. St Marks is free to see the main bit but will cost to see the interesting parts as you go along. The best plan is to just get lost and enjoy wandering around the many beautiful streets and canals. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chase11mckmck
Reviews.Content: My mother and I did a 3 city tour of Italy and this was the nicest hotel of the 3. Keep in mind that this hotel is NOT on the main Venice island but on Lido. This can be good and bad. Bad because it felt like alot of our days were spent on the waterbus rather than actually being at the sites. Good because you get a completely different perspective....the main Venice island feels like mainly gobs of tourists. Lido is where the locals live. So it is more relaxed and no real crowds. (Although I understand Lido is the place to be in the summer because of the beach on the opposite side of the island as the hotel). Anyhow, regarding this hotel...rooms were small but nice, breakfast was great-many choices, hotel was tidy, centrally located on Lido - within 2-3 blocks of the waterbus station and in the middle of all of the restaurants and shops. Staff was so-so. One of the guys was very nice, the others did not pay us much attention.

Reviews.Title: “hotelsinvenice.com baiting and switching reservations”
Reviews.Author: chris j
Reviews.Content: My reservation was for a Monday and Tuesday night in late October. (off-season) I was offered a very reasonable price at Le Boulevard. 4 stars. When I arrived, I was told that my room had water damaged and was no longer available. I said no problem, I will take another room. I was told there were no rooms available at the hotel and smoothly said they would be happy to set me up at a sister hotel. I found this all suspicious. Then I asked, how much would I be compensated? they responded nothing, despite the next hotel not being in the same star class. They didnt arrange any travel for me to go to the next hotel or make anything more convenient for me as a backpacker. Thinking something was up at the next hotel I checked the website to see if I could make a reservation at Le Boulevard. Sure enough, there were several rooms available including the very specifics of the room I booked. Booking.com was also still advertising rooms at the hotel for that very night. I took pictures of all this and wrote to them about the situation. The Hotel responded to be over a day later only saying that it was a system flaw- a convenient response in light of everything thats happened. What I believe is taking place is that they are playing with reservations in their chain to maximize profits as they speculate which hotels have more availability that night. A clear 'bait and switch' attracting reservations which the affordable price for a 4 star then passing the reservations off to other hotels in the chain for the evening. I met a couple at a restaurant who had the same type of thing happen to them, though the excuse was not water damage but rather they have indication of reservation but not confirmation, but they will be set up elsewhere. Fraud in short.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to scratch.”
Reviews.Author: LeChatGris11
Reviews.Content: On the Island of Lido, Italy. This hotel is lovely looking from the outside, the inside lobby area, dining area etc. This hotel is ideal to stay in because it has a great location AWAY from those horrific Venice crowds and it is a pleasant boat ride back to the main attractions at Venice. HOTEL ROOMS : These are small and somewhat stuffy. We arrived in November 2011, with fairly coolish temperatures outside. The heating was way too high in the hotel, and we had to resort to opening the windows at night to have some air circulation as the air conditioning unit made a terrible noise. In fact, I don't know if the "cooling" part of the air conditioning worked. When one opens the windows, the noise from the outside comes straight into the room - this isn't too bad during the day, but at night it does disturb sleep. Otherwise it was clean and quiet. BATHROOM : Clean and neat and a full sized bath in our room which was pleasant - though we did not use it. The bathroom window is a trap! Our room had a bathroom window which actually fell right out of its frame when I tried to open it. I let the hotel know about this. Beware travellers! BREAKFAST : Typical European breakfast of cereal, cheese, cold meat/salami and pastries. The breakfast room is quite ornate and mirrored. The heating is again, way too high to enjoy it for too long. OK, here's where I have to air my grievance a bit. The receptionists were all very helpful if a little reserved, but this is extremely professional. However, when we asked the gentleman at the reception which boat we could take to Murano to the glass factory he told us the following: a) He would arrange to have one of his colleagues take us down to the boat jetty to have a special boat take us there for free. b) And then we would have a boat trip back to Venice. What ACTUALLY happens is this:- Yes, the boat is a free ride to the factory. But nothing is free in this world... The alleged "glass factory" is not what you think it is. According to a local of 45 years, this Murano glass factory is just a selling tool to get you to buy from them. You arrive and you are ushered into a demonstration room where three glass blowers are making some ornamental trinkets. Then afterwards, you are guided through the various show rooms and encouraged to buy. The salesman does not stop showing you things and offering you "special prices" for your visit. A note here : an aquarium type piece featuring fish, bubbles etc was priced there at E4,500 (Yes, four thousand five hundred Euros). He offered a few hundred off at a special price. The SAME one is found on Lido at E1,500. Now once you buy you are hurried out of the showrooms to make room for the next customer - it's not a subtle gesture either. It's "ok, go now. I get boat" type of thing. We waited for a boat to take us back to Venice as promised (in the rain and wind, alone on the jetty). Finally, I went back inside and hung around trying to get someone's attention. Finally, it was the boat driver who patently ignored us 25 minutes previously when arriving on the jetty saying "no no I don't know who" (he didn't want to take us back - he went inside and had coffee and a gossip with his mates instead). This is hard, hard sell and unless you are a determined shopper who never falls for this type of scam, do NOT go there. I found earrings for myself at a "special" price and was hugely disappointed to find the same ones at 1/3 of the price at Venice. Oh well, live and learn I guess. As we spent several days in Lido we got to know a few of the shop keepers around and they were very happy to tell us that the Hotels take a "cut" of the sold goods on the Murano island "factory". They say it is a shop only, as the real glass factories are absolutely out of bounds to tourists and the public (which makes perfect sense, when one considers workplace health and safety laws). I am not sure on this, but I heard it several times, so I can only pass on what I know and say BEWARE. On a more positive note, the Hotel is right in the hub of Lido. It's a ten minute walk to a laundromat (where the soap and softener is automatically added to the washers)!! A walk further will take you to the beach. Next door to Hotel is a Billa market for food etc and there are loads of little bars or restaurants around. Another tip. Try not to buy Venice jewellery. It is overpriced and is aimed squarely at tourists who have no sense when on holidays. Everything is overpriced. Everything!! So go and enjoy your sights but keep the jewellery buying to somewhere off the beaten tourist track. If you do want to buy some gold or silver from Italy, then I recommend the only jeweller in Lido who has somewhat different pieces and has reasonable prices. Would I stay on Lido again instead of Venice? Definitely yes. Not in high summer though. The crowds would be a huge put off. Would I stay in Le Boulevard Hotel again? Hmmmm, I don't know about that. Maybe not. I'd have to see what else was around before choosing this place again. It's the noise and the air-conditioning and the sleight of hand with the Murano Glass "Factory" which put me off. My rating on rooms and sleep quality are down because of the stuffiness etc.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: hardworkingsinglemum
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a three night stay at this hotel. I am a single parent with two children 11 and 14. Great location and next door to a supermarket which was useful for supplies. Only a few minutes walk to vaporetto and we enjoyed the journey into Venice central. I would have preferred to stay in the centre of Venice but by the time I booked there was not much availability so this seemed like the next best thing. Hotel was old fashioned in a good sense, I found the receptionists very polite and helpful speaking excellent English. The room was smallish but extremely clean and comfortable and I had no problems with the daily servicing. Only downside was that due to location near the supermaket there was some noise with deliveries starting shortly after six am, this did not wake the kids but I am a light sleeper so I woke up quite early which could be viewed as an advantage in any case. Breakfast was fine with lots of different types of food to choose from. Not a luxury hotel but I was not expecting that from the price I paid. A good choice for a mid range hotel close to Venice. I would have given it a five star if it were not for the noise from the supermarket. I would definately stay here again so thanks everyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location : shame about the hotel”
Reviews.Author: ianboardman64
Reviews.Content: The picture of the hotel promised much and we were prepared to be open minded notwithstanding some of the reviews we had read. On arrival at 1.20pm we were met with a strict "room only available at 2.00pm" less than friendly response which just about summed up all our dealings with reception ! The best that could be said about the room we had was that it was clean and functional albeit on the small side. The only meal provided was breakfast which at best was passable although not enjoyable. There were constant requests for replacement of food which went unheeded by the waiters who were surly and seemed to do as little as possible to get by. Beware the new "tourist tax" which we and other travellers were asked to pay on departure. Will be taking up with our travel agent.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been a good hotel only if they could employ some friendly and helpful receptionists”
Reviews.Author: joshanuk75
Reviews.Content: Good: location on island of Lido is good. Lido is about 30 minutes away from Venice central by water taxi. Hotel is close to beach and vapareto. The location is very central. There is also a supermarket virtually next to hotel. Many bars and restaurants are virtually a stone throw away. Breakfast was good. Continental of course but was glad to discover poached eggs and bacon. Got satellite tv and fridge in room. Breakfast waiter was very helpful unlike the receptionists but we'll talk about that later. We booked a family room which was decent size and a normal double room which was really really small. Set in typical Venetian decor and cleanliness was ok. Not so good: the staff specially 2 men (at different parts of day) were most unhelpful. Very regimental attitude and did not show any flexibility. Overall: good location but could do with some modernisation in rooms. Staff could attend some courses in good manners.

Reviews.Title: “nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: erickMedellin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on Lido Island, you can go by car taken the ferry or by other transportation like the vaporetto. Close, you will find many nice restaurants and a nice street to walk. IÂ´ll take like to 15 minutes to get Venice downtown. The rooms are nice and the breakfast is a buffet with a nice and complete options.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Hotel and Welcoming Staff”
Reviews.Author: Axle75
Reviews.Content: Hotel was easy to find and nice and close to beach and Vaporetto station. Nice and cool inside when it was 34 degrees C outside. Hotel Manager and staff were very polite and helpful and spoke very good English despite my poor attempts to speak Italian. Hotel Manager was very kind in letting us keep the room until the afternoon as we had an evening flight. Cant really think of anything negative to say about my stay at Le Boulevard. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable - Well Worth a Revisit”
Reviews.Author: Otisgrandad
Reviews.Content: We were here for only one night post cruise. Easily accessible by water bus, 200 yards from terminal. Friendly staff, clean room, air con that worked, varied, plentiful breakfast. In marked contrast to my previous review of Hotel Villa Isabella.

Reviews.Title: “A friendly haven in the bustle of Venice”
Reviews.Author: shinafoot
Reviews.Content: We all know Venice is spectacular, but to stay on the Lido lets you unwind at the end of a busy touring day. Just a short vaporetta trip across the lagoon, and 5 minutes walk from the docking station, and Le Boulevard is a peaceful haven, with plenty of lovely restaurants around, within walking distance, to spend the evenings. The hotel staff are friendly, helpful and efficient, and the hotel has a lovely Venetian style throughout. The management are always ready to help you with travel arrangements and advice on where to go - if only they did meals there, I'd probably never see much of Venice! But we have been using this hotel for over 10 years, and come back annually for our 'fix' of Venetian charm and relaxation

Reviews.Title: “Great staff. Each one of them were stars.”
Reviews.Author: missmorgan13
Reviews.Content: We booked in for three nights at this hotel. The pictures on it's website don't do it justice. It is much better in real life. It has an oldie world feel to it although it is spotlessly clean. The room we stayed in could be described as 'cosy', but it had everything you need. The staff at the hotel were some of the most helpful I've ever come across in my many, many years of travelling the globe. Going over and above their individual duty to ensure wee had a lovely stay there. 5 mins walk from the vaparetto stop, 7 to 10 mins to the beach. I would hhighly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Strategic location, just 5 mins walking to nearest water taxi stn”
Reviews.Author: BambangKaro
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with elegant room design. Location is strategic, just 5 mins walking distance from 'Lido' water taxi station.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, cozy rooms”
Reviews.Author: writecritic
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and we enjoyed our stay. The people at the reception gave us an upgrade ( without even asking for it!). The hotel itself, is on Lido Island but it's very easy to reach Venice st Mark's square by the vaporetto (water bus). The frequency of buses is very good and the number 1 water bus stops at every stop so you can hop in and hop off as and when you please. The hotel is about 5 mins walking distance from the waterbus station so you can come late at night without any stress. Personally, I like my rooms a bit bigger but given that this is Venice, that's too much to ask for. The room itself, is well designed and cozy. It has a desk, a TV ( has English news channels) and sufficient wardrobe space. However, if you are traveling with huge bags and suitcases, you might find it a bit difficult to make space for them in the room. The bathroom was well stocked and very clean. We did not opt for the breakfast on day 1 but after having spent a lot more money outside on day 1 eating average stuff, we decided to eat breakfast on day 2 at the hotel. We were glad we did that. There was a lot of variety and it was affordable. Over all, we were very happy with the service and enjoyed our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “good location but room very small.”
Reviews.Author: Sid53_11
Reviews.Content: My daughter and i stayed here for four nights. We were disappointed with the bedroom but the bathroom was quite nice and very clean. The site gives the impression that the hotel has complimentary chairs and umbrellas on the beach but this is not the case. These cost 20 euros for the day. The service from reception was generally good but i found the bar staff a little worrying. One evening when we were sitting outside the barman clicked his fingers at me to get me to move. Apparently he wished to close the sun shade for the evening. If he had asked me to move to another table this would have been fine but he was just very rude. As he had done the same to an Australian woman the previous night we did have a word with the duty manager to ask him to explain to the staff why this was not acceptable. I dont think that the manager really understood but both he and the barman knocked on my door later [about 10.30] to try and have a discussion about it. I think in the end it was just a clash of cultures. It was also likely to be a gender issue as both men clearly did not understand 'my problem'. We are not likely to return as Venice is so very expensive but it was so beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good standard, Pleasent staff.”
Reviews.Author: Shart7
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was excellent value, the rooms were fine and the Breakfast was fair. The location of the Hotel was great right in the main street., and 5 mins from the water bus , Rooms were a little warm, but generally comfortable. Staff were helpful and overall a very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed and certainly not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: LimariaArboleas
Reviews.Content: The room was rather small and the bathroom was so dark - dark red tiles with a brown wooden ceiling - quite depressing. The bed was very comfortable. The hotel needs some tlc to make it 4 star, e.g. the carpets, paintwork, etc and the room was never cleaned while we were though, the sheets were changed and the towels but there was dust on every surface. The staff were friendly and helpful and the breakfast was quite good. However this hotel is definitely not 4 star quality and we wouldnÂ´t stay there again. The location was quite good for the vaporetto and there were some restaurants close by.

Reviews.Title: “Great Break”
Reviews.Author: ScottyG23
Reviews.Content: Was sent here because the hotel we were staying in overbooked, turned out to be our best night in Venice. Hotel was clean, staff was wonderful! Don't know about the other reviews saying tiny rooms, our room was terrific and rather large for European travel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Break”
Reviews.Author: rodgster
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights pre-cruise. Had a fantastic stay. Staff was very helpful and the room on the 3rd floor was big and clean. Breakfast was plain, but then again I am not a breakfast person. Hotel was easy to get to from the airport by water bus. Outside the hotel was various shops restaurants and numerous ice creams parlour. Would stay again definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Room”
Reviews.Author: Missronnie
Reviews.Content: This hotel room was unacceptable. No room to put two suitcases. Would recommend you rethink if considering it. Also very noisy - street noise.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: Malvernlap
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Venice and were booked into Le Boulevard on the island of Lido by Airmiles. As I used points to pay for the trip I have no idea if Le Boulevard is good value. But we found it very quiet and in an excellent location for catching the Water Bus into St Marks Square (a 12 minute ride). The room and bathroom were very clean and the reception staff helpful and polite. On the negative side, the breakfast was probably the worst I have experienced in any hotel. I would still recommend this hotel highly. NB. we saw many tourists pulling their suitcases through the maze that is Venice, obviously trying to find their hotel! The Lido was ideal.

Reviews.Title: “good location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: pinkladynewcastle
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights last week. the hotel is in a fantastic location only 2 mins walk to the vaperetto stop and has bars and resurantes on your doorstep.The hotel staff are pleasant and helpfull. The breakfast was ok but the clearing of the tables was not. If you were not one of the first at the table you had to clear it yourself.When we arrived we were given our room the fridge wasn't working but we were promptly moved to another room which i had to say was a lot nicer than the first room.I would definatly go back to this hotel and recommend it .Across the road is a bar called jereboam. It is well worth a visit as the staff are great and the prices are reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Room”
Reviews.Author: PhilJune
Reviews.Content: when we arrived at the Hotel, the service was pleasent and easygoing, we were given our room key, and when we went up to our room, alas it was not what we was expecting, the room if you want to call it a room was the tiniest room we have stayed in, we went down stairs and asked if all the rooms were the same size, which he replied yes, we found out later that this was not the case, but as we were only staying for 3 nights we would let this go. Venice was great but expensive, I was happy to have gone to Venice, but once is enough. I recommend that any one going to Venice and doing a lot of sight seeing, buy yourself a 72 hour pass 33 euros(depending how long you stay) you can hop on and off the water buses as much as you want.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel and great position”
Reviews.Author: tony187065
Reviews.Content: Le Boulevard is situated 2 minutes walk from the water taxis for Venice from the Lido. Room 328 was big and roomy. Breakfasts were plentiful. reception were always pleasant and helpful. Situated near to restarants - reaonable price and over the road from a supemarket. would use this hotel again and recommend it for short breaks in Venice

Reviews.Title: “We will come back!!”
Reviews.Author: Jiasa
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel with my boyfriend for 6 nights and weI really enjoyed it. The room wes very clean and we think that spaceous enough, the only "problem" was the matress (too soft)... The breakfast was also very good (nothing special but good). We've loved Lido island: the beach, the bikes (you have to rent one to really know Lido) and the bar/restaurants. The location of the hotel is perfect: 2 minutes from the vaporetto (the aquatic bus) and then 10/15 minutes to Piazza San Marco (we were never tired of the travel). It is also 5 minutes walking from the beach and you have lots of restauranst/bars/shops in the surroundings of the hotel. We will come back!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Service, Bad Location, Small Room”
Reviews.Author: hkmny
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was friendly and helpful with directions, etc. The lobby area was small but nice, and the room was very small--probably typical of Venice. The main problem with the hotel is its location. It was also kind of noisy around the hotel. There are a decent amount of small restaurants/cafes right near the hotel. Wifi works ok, but relatively expensive. Lido Island is the last boat stop from the train station--takes about 45 mins to 1 hour plus 10-15 minute wait. From Lido to St. Marks it's 4 stops and ~15 minutes. The hotel is good value for the cost, but you will spend a lot of time on the boats(similar to public buses).

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable good value conveniently sited for water-buses”
Reviews.Author: Alex99England
Reviews.Content: We had a large room with an excellent bathroom . It was airconditioned , with double glazing . There is a good choice at breakfast , but they were a bit slow in refilling empty dishes . It was friendly , and well placed for water buses to Venice , and a variety of restaurants . The room fridge did not work , and a lot of street noise , but the double glazing kept this out at night

Reviews.Title: “Great location, reception staff unhelpful”
Reviews.Author: kimberdragon
Reviews.Content: We got this 4* hotel for Â£10 each p/r p/n so it was a bargain, after such an amazing hotel in Rome for the same price expectations were high. It is a nice hotel and the porter and maids are absolutely lovely, but the reception staff are just unhelpful, not rude or unhappy, just unhelpful like your an inconvenience to them, they spent most of their time playing on the internet!! The room itsself only had a couple of skylights and the room was adequate in size, but there was a strange smell all the time and it wasn't coming from me!! Bathroom was a good size though. It is a nice hotel all said and thats what this review is for. Nightlife is limited, don't go if you want clubs etc but if you want to people watch its ideal, we liked it anyway. Lido de Venezia is loverly, there's a nice Chinese restaurant, very cheap and the staff are aweful, it really is an experience, but the food is lovely and it's cheap. The hotel is by the Vaporetto terminus.....it costs a bomb, buy a 24 hr ticket (about 15 euros) and don't swipe it see how long you can get away with it for, but it is the only way on and off the lido. Venice itself is absolutely mindblowing, sucha beautiful city. The beach is massive but the sea is a bit minging WARNING..... take mosquito repellant, lots of people with massive mossi bites!!!

Reviews.Title: “over”
Reviews.Author: erikaDublin
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel recently, supposed to be four star,id rate it at two star at most.i l left some items in my room by mistake when i checked out.. i went back a couple of hours later to ask for them and was told there was already another guest in the room and the staff didn't find anything.even though i am 100% sure they were there when i left. when i said this they became very rude. somebody at the hotel is dishonest.i would be worried about leaving anything of any value in he room..

Reviews.Title: “over rated”
Reviews.Author: Hotclive
Reviews.Content: We stayed there one night. When we booked it on the internet we thought we had the deal of the century as it was rated 4 stars for only 100 euros. As soon as we arrived we realized that the place wasn't as "billed". The main issue was that we had expected much more. The room was tiny; the service was negligible and the breakfast below what we were used to for a 4 star hotel. There are no amenities either. On the plus side, it has a great location on the main street of the Lido and was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Be warned . Pretentious overrating itself and facilites”
Reviews.Author: shaggylamb
Reviews.Content: My bathroom was clean but bath too short. I cannot think of anything to recommend this hotel except to get away from the bustle of Venice in summer. The noise through the bedroom wall from the bathroom next door was embarrassing,including flushing the toilet. The bed completely filled the room with little extra space. The wardrobe mirror was cracked and covered with a strip of clear scotch tape. The front panel was grubby from old stains of coca cola. Immediately outside the window were a hundred cigarettes butts. The breakfast room was barely supervised , this allowed several guest to remove large quantities of rolls and bacon as well as drink in their own bags. No food in the hot tray on my first day.No napkins on second day Faulty switch on toaster,bread would not brown. Cappuccino coffee could be ordered if the waiter was present .On the way to my room the bellboy seemed to take an intent interest in my single status.A discussion on the weather would have been more appropiate! I have stayed many times in Venice but never before on the lido.It is a good place as a base to reach other islands by bus and boat using a travel pass as well as Venice itself. Good supermarket next to hotel for snacks rather than take from the breakfast room! The elegantly dressed reception staff seemed out of place in an establishment that merely offers mediocre bed and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Mike072
Reviews.Content: Stayed last week in July so it was HOT and the aircon in this hotel really is very good. The staff were all very helpful, breakfast is OK, the same every morning and typical hotel fayre. Its a great location just a minute or so from the vaporetto which is only 12 minutes from St Marks across the lagoon. Unlike Venice Island the Lido is more informal all shorts and T shirts although it's just as expensive to eat and drink, however there is a good supermarket almost next door and the hotel didn't object to us buying a bottle of wine and sitting both in their lounge or under their parasols and drinking it, they even provided glasses, as I said great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: importedinteriors
Reviews.Content: During our first visit to Venice, we relied upon the ratings from trip advisor and stayed at this hotel...we were very happy..hotel is located in Lido Island, just a short water taxi trip to st. marks square, and without the high prices that you find on the mainland.... taxis are available 24 hours and are cheap....the rooms were comfortable and the bathroom (considering that europe hotels have tiny baths) were spacious...especially the shower. The front desk personnel were very helpful and went out of their way the guide us and gave us maps and guide books. The breakfast was quite elaborate...we have no complaints...we highly recommend this place...you wont be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “You might have your credit card overcharged...”
Reviews.Author: Jenna8687
Reviews.Content: The members of this hotel was soooo friendly when I decided to book a room with them...but as soon as I decided to cancel it two weeks b4 my trip they became really rude and cold. That day they reassured me they would not charge me for cancelling my reservation but I found a charge of Â£110 on my account from them at the end of the month and I am still fighting for my refund; when I told that to the friend that had stayed at that hotel and had recommended it to me he checked his bank account and realised they had charged him Â£45 extra than his bill stated....so watch out!

Reviews.Title: “Ideally placed”
Reviews.Author: somersetbob
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on recommendation from friends. Ideally situated on the Lido. All restaurants / cafe's / bars / beach a short walk away as is the waterbus stop (2 minutes walk if you stroll!). The hotel is very clean, full breakfast between 7 -9.45 am each day. Rooms have safe deposit boxes at no cost and considering it is on the corner of a busy street it's very quiet. No kids either! You have to be over 16 to stay. Only downside was the bar rarely seemed to be open and when it is it closes at 11pm. Nonetheless, there are so many other places to go within a very short distance.

Reviews.Title: “Just Leave it to the Bellboy”
Reviews.Author: Staidthere
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Le Boulevard Hotel for two nights while on a Trafalgar tour. Two cute stories showing how they never learn from ever-repeating oversights: (first story) our group of 48 people picked up keys at the reception desk and hunted for rooms. The single lift was slow and usually occupied, so we carried our shoulder bags up to the fourth floor to find our room, 432. There was a room 433, but no 432. Still puffing after the walk-up, I left my wife and shoulder bag on the 4th floor and walked down to reception to ask the whereabouts of the missing room 432. The man at reception rang a bell and a bellboy appeared, asked for my key, and ceremoniously walked me about 10 paces away from the reception desk to room 432 on the ground floor. He opened the door of my room with a great show of helpfulness. When I asked for the key back so I could go fetch my wife on the 4th floor, he exclaimed, "Oh my God!" as if no other guest had a similar experience. (Second story) I brought our ice pack to reception to ask that it be put in the freezer, and again the bell was rung and the same ubiquitous bellboy appeared and took the ice pack to be put in the freezer. The next morning we found that it was put in the refrigerator and not in the freezer. The bellboy was no longer ubiquitous. The 4-star hotel provided Kleenex tissue in the bathroom and English language news on TV. The buffet breakfast included scrambled eggs. Wireless Internet service was available for Eur 5 for an hour and Eur 10 for 4 hours. The Internet time can be consumed in many small sessions, but it seemed to us that 4 hours expired awfully quickly. Our room 432 seemed quite large, and the bathroom was adequate. The hotel is in a good neighborhood among shops on the main street of the Lido, a short walk from the Lido boat landing where it costs Euro 6.50 one way to Piazza San Marco.

Reviews.Title: “Hated this hotel”
Reviews.Author: jessjames
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in August as part of of a coach tour. Supposed to be first class accommodation but far from it. I felt sick when I was out and thought about coming back to the room and I'm sure this has had an overall effect on my opinion of Venice as a whole. Never want to come back! If you go ahead and book this hotel and get given room 429 then my advice is to ask for another room. Good luck. The guy on reception didn't seem to care when I asked for another room. It is a tiny attic room with no window (unless you count the window in the bathroom but you have to stand in the bath to see out) but two skylights - 1 of which didn't open. If you sleep on the left side of the double bed and are taller than a dwarf you will have to walk bent over to save hitting your head. We had to put a table into the wardrobe in order to get enough room on the floor for two suitcases. The only thing in its favour was that the bathroom was a reasonable size (about the same as the bedroom) as others on the tour were complaining about the size of their bathrooms. If you are wanting this location I'm sure you would find a better hotel in the vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: SwatiRathi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little away from the center in a lovely island called Lido. Very close to the beach and lot of nice eating joints. Was a little dissapointed by the room size. We took the economy room and had no space to walk or keep our suitcase! Go for the bigger rooms which I am told, are double the size of the economy ones.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs......”
Reviews.Author: Curiousinmd
Reviews.Content: Due to some flight problems (mainly how disorganized and chaotic London Heathrow as an airport is) we were unable to make it to Venice for the first of a two night stay at Hotel Le Boulevard. We were also unable to get through to Hotels.com or Le Boulevard (believe me I tried for 4 hours) to tell them about our plane delays which cost us an extra night in London on top of not making it for our first night in Venice. When we finally did get to the hotel the following day the staff at Le Boulevard informed me that they had already given our room away and we would still be charged for both nights. The staff gave the impression of not really caring at all but did make one call and it so happened that a hotel just down the street did have a triple room that we could take while Le Boulevard and Hotels.com sorted out the booking mess between the two. After several discussions between both hotels.com and the staff at Le Boulevard it was decided that I would still have to pay for both nights, however since they had rented out our room Le Boulevard would pay for our night at the other hotel. At the time this seemed satisfactory to me after all the stress of just getting to Venice and being able to sleep. Upon trying to check out the following morning our hotel (Atlanta) calls Le Boulevard regarding the previous agreement and is told by a different individual at Le Boulevard who claimed to be the manager, that he would under no circumstances pay for our room regardless of what his colleague had agreed to. I spoke with this individual as well and out of all the rude Venetians I dealt with this guy takes the cake! So after another extensive call to Hotels.com I am told to pay for the room, submit the receipt to hotels.com, and they reimburse me (which they did). But hotels.com did mention that this is not the first problem they have had with the staff at Le Boulevard. So while the hotel appeared to be nice (not necessarily 3.5 stars), the staff at this hotel is atrocious.

Reviews.Title: “Poorly managed 2 star standard hotel”
Reviews.Author: kb1977
Reviews.Content: The previous reviewer was bang on, you should base your expectations on the price you pay, not the fact this hotel claims to be 4 star. If it was advertised as a 2 star you might be pretty happy with what you got. The hotel is very badly managed and understaffed. there are reviews on this site from 2-3 years ago saying the same thing and they clearly haven't learned anything in that time. We paid Â£80 for the larger room on expedia, don't pay more than that! There was a group of very rowdy excited school children aged 13-14 in every room on our floor (1st floor) except ours, so we asked to move after the first night and they were really funny about it - but I insisted and insisted and was eventually given quite a lovely room on the top floor (even thought they were adamant they had absolutely no other rooms available) which was silent for the next 3 nights. The two rooms we stayed in had been refurbished - but done up in a n old fashioned style - lots of mahogany and deep reds and greens - not my cup of tea at all. Breakfast is appalling - awful food, 30 unclean tables every morning. A huge group of backpackers arrived whilst we were there - this is just above hostel standard acomodation and popular with backpackers as not much more than a hostel price and they get a private room. The smaller budget priced rooms are the smallest I have ever seen and are not worth the Â£70 per night (unless you are backpacking). The rooms are clean though, and it is in an excelent location. The waterbuses are very regular and the 62 and 51/52 takes 35 minutes to P. de Roma, or the 82 and 51 take 15 minutes to Saint Mark's Square. The number 1 takes a bit longer as it stops at every stop - though worth it if you get the front seats outside to go all the way up the grand canal. Venice is very expensive - there is even a charge to get in some churches! Every toilet is 1 euro and drinks in main square 16 euros for a Bellini/cocktail! Some of the Lido bars near the hotel do an excellent freshly made Bellini for 3 euros! A beautiful city - once you lose the tourists - and I wouldn't hesitate to return - just not to Le Boulevard!

Reviews.Title: “Just brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: CatBristol
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel at the end of January, for 3 nights. It was absolutely fantastic! My partner booked the break for my Christmas present and then subsequently read some pretty unsatisfactory reviews about the hotel, so we were a little anxious, however the staff were incredibly friendly and spoke about 4 languages each, the room was clean and comfortable, the service was excellent, the food that was provided for breakfast was good and you could help yourself as many times as you like and nothing was too much trouble. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “avoid like the plague!!!”
Reviews.Author: Louiseos
Reviews.Content: I could spend hours writing a review about this hotel, but unfortunately it would all be negative and I feel that it wouldn't be worth my time. I would say read the other reviews and take the negative ones on board - there is a whole lot of truth there . . . I'm just sorry that we gave them the benefit of the doubt . . . . Spend a little extra and stay somewhere else . . . Lido isn't the problem .. .its this hotel . . . Enough said.

Reviews.Title: “Go at your own risk”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: How come it takes a hotel two months to decide that it can't keep its promise? I can only assume the management got a better offer as this is Film Festival time. I CERTAINLY WILL NEVER TRUST THIS HOTEL AGAIN. This is the email: We are sorry to inform you that the reservation Nr 24315 made in date 16/05/2006 for the hotel Le Boulevard located in Venezia Lido, Lido di Venezia -Gran Viale Santa Maria Elisabetta, 41, for the period from the 08/09/2006 to the 10/09/2006 has been cancelled in date 13/07/2006

Reviews.Title: “Could do better”
Reviews.Author: sakyasage
Reviews.Content: My first impression of this hotel was very favourable. I arrive 2 hours before check in, wringing wet after my short walk in a violent thunderstorm. I was given a free drink by the man on the front desk and they rushed to get my room ready and let me check in early.. However, there were one or two problems. The only Italians that work in the hotel are on the front desk and most were helpful, except the young one that worked the night/ early morning shift that was very grumpy and surly. The chambermaids and porters are all Filipinos, they are all helpful, but the hotel is seriously understaffed. At one time a porter was trying to check someone in, serve a drink in the bar and take someoneâ€™s bags to the lift all at the same time as he was the only one about. The hotel is very clean as was my room. The hotel is decorated blandly, (except for my bathroom which was blood red) with nothing to suggest that you were in Venice, I could be anywhere in the world. I had booked a single room, and I think that the room would have be ok with a single bed, but I was surprised to see that there was a double bed which completely dominated the room. The bathroom only had a shower and it was a very small cubicle. If you drop the soap in the shower you could not bend down the pick it up, you had the get out of the shower to do it. One plus was the aircon worked very well as the temperatures were in the low 30Âºs. The breakfast was the continental, cold meats, cheeses, pastries, cereals plus scrabble eggs and bacon. Fruit juices and coffee are from a machine, the coffee was very strong and the juice seemed watered down. They had a coach load of American tourists for two days of the four that I stayed there, and they did not seem able to cope with such a large amount of people at breakfast, food run out, table left dirty. On he other day that I stayed there things were ok. Venice is great, and this is my third trip (the first on my own) and the Lido is the perfect place to use as your base. Overall seeing that I was staying on my own, the location was good and the hotel was cheap for Venice, I would stay there again under similar circumstances. However if I was staying with my wife I would think twice about staying there. .

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First of all, thanks for all the comments below, they are really helpful! Before I booked the hotel I was not sure, but I am quite satisfied with the hotel! Do not worry about the bad comments. Two friends and I stayed at this hotel for the New Year's eve 2005. The Hotel is easily reached by boat from Santa Lucia, but it is a long trip, around 30 mins by Line 51 or even longer with 1. Then from the ferry stop Lido, it is only 3 mins walk and a supermarket is next door to the hotel. The hotel has a nice interior and our triple room is not too small. We had a double bed and a single bed. There was a mini bar and TV/Telephone as well. The breakfast was nice even with hot food.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Lido but Dont stay at Le Boulevard”
Reviews.Author: bexmex
Reviews.Content: We went to Venice June of 05, we had heard that Lido Island was the place to stay and we found that very true. The island is only a 15 minute vaporetto ride from Venice and is quiet and quaint. We had paid reservations at Le Boulevard hotel but when we arrived the clerk Michael, explained to us that he didnt have our room so he sent us 4 blocks down to another hotel that they use as an overflow, and we would have to change rooms the next night. That hotel put us in a room across the street from the main hotel. The room was filthy and beat up, with nowhere to put clothes or suitcases. We paid 287.00 for a fri night and 199.00 for a sun. I asked the hotel they sent us to that if I had walked in and asked for a room it would have cost 125.00 We returned to Le Boul. to compain and had to threaten to call our travel agent when they miraculously found us a room. They reluctantly gave us a room that was "smaller than we had paid for" their words. But refused to give us a credit for the difference. Not Worth the hassle on vacation. Spend your money with a hotel who cares about their clientele. Also the free breakfast was cold eggs and bacon.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: JessandDan
Reviews.Content: The best thing about Le Boulevard is the location. Providing you get the right vaporetto it is only 15 minutes max. from St Mark's Square. If you take the wrong vaporetto however it will take you up to 45 minutes. Check in was fine, greeted by polite receptionist who gave us a room on a high floor as we requested. Our room was very average, small but clean, bathroom well stocked, very small but functional. The breakfast room was worse than Fawlty Towers. We were there for 3 nights and the service was non-existent every morning. We were going to breakfast at about 8am and there were no clean tables at any time. No other guests were in the dining room but there was nowhere clean to sit. No clean cups. crockery, cutlery, the hot chocolate machine was not switched on, the toaster did not toast and not much choice of anything else. There was no sign of Manuel (or any other waiter for that matter) until someone complained at reception. We were then given a cup with lipstick on. Give this hotel a miss if you usually like four star service. I would give this hotel two stars maximum and would not recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Shopaholic2208
Reviews.Content: While Le Boulevard is not the most Italian of hotels, it is clean, well-maintained, smart and boasts excellent staff. While I'd agree that the breakfasts were different, there is something to suit pretty much every taste and offers excellent bread. I'd disagree with the comment that it was noisy, staying on the second floor, we did not find this to be a problem at all. The Lido itself is wonderful and offers the opportunity to combine a beach holiday with a city break. The beach was clean and rubbish free when we stayed, admittedly at the height of the season, and not crowded at all. I would recommend getting a Venice Card that allows unlimited use of the water buses, as you will get the most out of your stay by viewing the city from the canals, route #1 and #24/25 especially.

Reviews.Title: “You can do better.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Boulevard for 2 nights in early March 2005. This hotel is located on Lido Island which is about 40 minutes away from the train station and generally about 30 minutes away from every attraction. The front desk staff member was over smart and inspite of us asking for a double bed, gave us 2 twin beds joined together. The rooms were decent but really small. Even though we got a non smoking room, it seemed like someone used it as a smoking room earlier. The hotel arranges for a ferry taxi ride to Murano glass factories. This is free of charge but they take you to a place that probably has a deal with the hotel. Its an enclosed glass factory and the sales representatives pressure you into buying. The items are over priced and they dont let you get out by yourself. The breakfast is really nice with eggs and toast. The hotel is pretty good but the location is out of the way. I would rather pay a little more and stay close by to main land Venice.

Reviews.Title: “pearl of the adriatic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from the hotel LE BOULEVARD on the lido its a perfect place to stay,only a short walk from the waterbus 5mins, all the staff were very helpful including reception and maids who changed bed linen daily,arriving back at hotel late evening or early morning it was no problem to open bar for a few drinks before retiring,breakfast was enough to keep us going till late pm plenty to eat .perfect eating place up the road the ROXY excellent food.VENICE is magical a must see place if you get the chance GO DERRYCK & PAT

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: eventslady
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Italy where we visited Milan, Rome and Venice. I booked this hotel on Expedia and was a little apprehensive to do so after I had read other people's reviews, however, I'm very glad I took the leap. Le Boulevard was a beautiful hotel, it was very easy to get to, only a short walk from the "vaporetto" dock (about 1 block), and we found it quite easily. As for staying in Lido as opposed to Venice, I would do it again in a minute, it was only a 35 min vaporetto ride to Venice, and you get to leave all the crowds behind. At the end of a long sightseeing day it was nice to take to ride back to Lido and unwind. We arrived at the hotel at 11:30 am w/luggage in tow, (check-in is at 2pm) and we wanted to leave our luggage so we could begin sightseeing right away, the hotel was kind enough to allow us to check-in early! The whole time of our stay from Dec-27-30, they were absolutely wonderful to us and to our two teens. It was very clean, and the breakfast was wonderful. Lots to eat, with a wonderful variety, more like a brunch. My kids were thrilled because they have a few computers w/internet access that they were able to purchase a few hours of use (5 Euros for 55 min), believe me w/teens who can't be away from their friends, it was a Godsend! Everyone in the hotel spoke English very well which made my family feel very confortable, since I am the official family interpreter. We had very comfortable beds and plenty of towels. Our room was a quad (which is rare in Venice) and it consisted of 4 single beds placed very closely together. It was just fine. Lovely furnishings throughout, and the hotel even arranged a FREE private water taxi when we wanted to go to the island of Murano. The lobby also had a DVD player which was great because while our kids were surfing the net we watched one of our DVD's we brought, and pretty soon we had families from all over the world joining us for our featured movie. I can't say enough about this hotel except STAY HERE! It was great in Dec I can imagine how wonderful it is in the spring and summer, very close location to the main "Lido Beach" an easy walk. Definitely a 4 star in my book!

Reviews.Title: “Venice review”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just came from our holiday in Venice. We were very dissapointed about the way we were treated by the Italians (Venitians). We got the feeling that they hate tourists and they were not very helpful when asking general questions. They dislike English speaking people. Lido: lots of old people and few young people. The public beach is very dirty and full of Rubbish. Billa Supermarket : Service very poor, but the products are very good and cheap. Buy ham and bread which are very good in Italy , so we haveno complaints about the food. Wine: At the supermarket is very cheap. About 50 - 80p for a cheap white or red. And that is for a litre! But the supermarket staff who serve the deli are nicer than the staff at the checkout. If you speak Italian they treat you differently (we are a bilingual Couple). Hotel Le Boulevard: very nice and clean but the lights are too dark. Bathroom very nice - beds clean but make sure you get a double bed instead of 2 singles pushed together. This took the shine of our stay a bit. Staff are nice and helpful. Breakfast: lots of choice- coffee was luke warm. overall= good but heavy. You can eat as much as you want. Venice: dont go to Venice unless it is sunny. We got so wet that we were fed up and could not appreciate the beauty of Venice to it's fullest. Forget the rainy season. See the top of the Campanille. It is amazing up there. See the museums and give yourself plenty of time for this. Macdonalds was not very clean. Coffee cost 1 euro here. Overall: dissapointed about the Venitian's treatment.
